basics.name: Zhaodong Liu
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: A Computer Science and Mathematics double major student at New York University Shanghai with research experience in generative retrieval and large language models.

highlights: Study-away Experience: NYU New York (Fall 2024, Spring 2025)

work.name: New York University Shanghai
highlights: Advisor: Prof. Hongyi Wen (Department of Computer Science, Data Science and Engineering)
Developed models to predict user click sequences on Amazon dataset
Designed and evaluated model architectures, including RQ-VAE and VQ-VAE, to capture discrete behavior patterns
Applied different tokenization methods, including BPE partitioning to improve sequence representation
Adapted the model architecture to support multi-modal representation learning

work.name: New York University Shanghai
work.summary: Driving Route Optimization Considering Traffic Light Timings
highlights: Advisor: Prof. Zhibin Chen (Department of Computer Science, Data Science and Engineering)
Developed an optimization system for traffic-aware route planning under real-world constraints
Applied several algorithms, including Dijkstra algorithm to compute the shortest path
Conducted simulations on real traffic signal records, showing preliminary improvements of speedup
